title: Bug 49235: ServletContainerInitializer onStartup(Set<Class<?> classSet) is not returning the expected class
description: When invoking the ServletContainerInitializer onStartup method with a Set of classes, the output is 'MySomeClass' instead of the expected 'MySomeAnn'.
OB: The method onStartup(Set<Class<?>> classSet, ServletContext ctx) prints 'MySomeClass' instead of 'MySomeAnn'.
EB: The onStartup method should print 'MySomeAnn' when called with the classSet containing MySomeAnn class.
SR:
To reproduce the issue: 
1. Build Tomcat 7.0.0 from svn r939221. 
2. Implement the class MySomeClass with the annotation @MySomeAnn. 
3. Implement the class ModuleInitializer with the @HandlesTypes(MySomeAnn.class) annotation. 
4. Override the onStartup(Set<Class<?>> classSet, ServletContext ctx) method in the ModuleInitializer class. 
5. Iterate over the classSet and print the targetClass name. 
6. Call the onStartup method passing the classSet and observe the output. 
Expected: 'MySomeAnn' is printed. 
Actual: 'MySomeClass' is printed.
